main event: A satellite was observed in the Gulf of Mexico by a radar operator on a British ship.
interesting points: The satellite was first observed at an altitude of 27° 30' and remained visible for 3 minutes.
The satellite appeared to have an erratic course in a southerly direction before disappearing from view at an altitude of 26°, bearing 045°.
The satellite was of the same brightness as the star Vega and was in sight for 7-8 minutes.
The weather was partly cloudy with good visibility, wind from the ENE at 10 knots, air temperature of 27°C, and sea temperature of 25°C.
The barometer was reading 1011.5 mb and rising.
witnesses: radar operator on British ship Leith Hill
